paper_abstract: In this paper, we associate to every planar polygon a complex polynomial, in which the blossom of the polynomial function captures the process in which linear transformations applied to the polygon lead to regular structures. In particular,. we prove, in a purely algebraic way several well-known theorems on polygons such as the Napoleon-Barlotti Theorem, the Petr-Douglas-Neumann Theorem, and the Fundamental Decomposition Theorem of polygons to regular polygons. paper_title: Complex Bezier curves and the geometry of polygons
